info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 9:15PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN POSSIBLE WITH RISING SNOW LEVELS LATE WEEK... Early signals are pointing to a possible atmospheric river event late this week into the weekend including warming temperatures, rising snow levels, and the potential for heavy rain. There is uncertainty regarding exactly which portions of Southeast Alaska will receive the heaviest precipitation, but current models show the northern and central panhandle as most likely to receive the highest amounts. General rainfall amounts of 4 inches or more are possible from Friday through Sunday. Snow levels are forecast to rise to around 2,000-3,000 feet over the northern panhandle and 5,000 feet over the southern panhandle which could lead to a melting mountain snowpack adding to the water flow. Please stay tuned to the forecast as it is refined through the week.
